00005 %> @brief This is two dimensional square discretization 
00006 %> grid.
00007 %
00008 %> This class contains methods for insert, get and display values from
00009 %> discretization grid. We can also add Discretization_grid_2D_square object's 
00010 %> to each other.
00011 % ectsim - Electrical Capacitance Tomography - Image Reconstruction Toolbox
00012 % ======================================================================
00013 classdef Discretization_grid_2D_square < Discretization_grid
00014 
00015    properties (SetAccess = public)
00016       %> number of x axis elements
00017       number_of_x_axis_pixel; 
00018       %> number of y axis elements
00019       number_of_y_axis_pixel;
00020       %> vector of x coordinates - linear index
00021       x_point_list;
00022       %> vector of y coordinates - linear index
00023       y_point_list;

00036    properties (SetAccess='private')

00038       lt=1;        
00039       %> upper threshold (use to display)

00045    methods (Access=public)
00046         % =================================================================
00047         %> @brief Constructor.
00048         %>
00049         %> @param varargin{1} matrix_size_mm (side size of discretization grid [mm])
00050         %> @param varargin{2} grid_size_mm (size of one element in discretization grid [mm])
00051         %>
00052         %> @return instance of the Discretization_grid_2D_square class.    
00053         % =================================================================
00054        function dg_obj = Discretization_grid_2D_square(varargin)   
00055            
00056            if nargin == 0 ; % no input arguments
00057            elseif isa(varargin{1},'Discretization_grid_2D_square')
00058             dg_obj = varargin{1}; % copy constructor
00059             display 'copy constructor Discretization_grid_2D_square'
00060             return; 
00061            else
00062                switch(nargin)
00063                    case 2, %matrix_size grid_size
00064                        
00065                        dg_obj.matrix_size_mm = varargin{1};
00066                        dg_obj.grid_size_mm   = varargin{2};                       
00067                        
00068                        % check is point number is even
00069                        if(~(mod(dg_obj.matrix_size_mm/dg_obj.grid_size_mm,2)==0))
00070                            error('The number matrix_size/grid_size_mm must be even');
00071                        end
00072                        
00073                        dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel=varargin{1}/varargin{2};  %matrix_size/grid_size;
00074                        dg_obj.discret_matrix_size=varargin{1}/varargin{2};     %matrix_size/grid_size;
00075                        
00076                        dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel=round(dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel);
00077                        dg_obj.number_of_y_axis_pixel=round(dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel);
00078                        
00079     
00080                        dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel=dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel; %
00081                        dg_obj.number_of_y_axis_pixel=dg_obj.number_of_y_axis_pixel;
00082                        number_of_all_pixel=dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel*dg_obj.number_of_y_axis_pixel;
00083                        
00084                        %allocate memory (increase speed)
00085                        ym=1:number_of_all_pixel;
00086                        xm=1:number_of_all_pixel;
00087                        
00088                        i=0;
00089                        for k=1:dg_obj.number_of_y_axis_pixel
00090                            for l=1:dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel
00091                                i=i+1;
00092                                xm(i)=k;
00093                                ym(i)=l;              
00094                            end
00095                        end
00096                        % blank discretization grid has value '1' in each point
00097                        val_tmp(1:i)=1;
00098                         
00099                        % create linear index 
00100                        dg_obj.x_point_list=xm;
00101                        dg_obj.y_point_list=ym;
00102                        dg_obj.value_list=val_tmp;   
00103                         
00104                        % matrix version; allocate memory
00105                        dg_obj.matrix=zeros(dg_obj.discret_matrix_size,dg_obj.discret_matrix_size);                                        
00106                        
00107                    otherwise
00108                        error('To less or to much input elements');                       
00109                end
00110            end
00111 
00112        end
00113        
00114         % =================================================================
00115         %> @brief  Insert value in grid (value_list vector) using rows and cols         
00116         %>         coordintes like in matrix.
00117         %>
00118         %> @param matrix_x_v vector of x coordinates
00119         %> @param matrix_y_v vector of y coordinates
00120         %> @param val vector of values
00121         %        
00122         % =================================================================       
00123         function insert_value_in_point(dg_obj,matrix_x_v,matrix_y_v,val)
00124 
00125             point=(matrix_x_v-1)*dg_obj.number_of_x_axis_pixel+matrix_y_v;
00126         
00127             dg_obj.value_list(point)=val;
00128 
00129         end
00130         
00131         % =================================================================
00132         %> @brief Get matrix version of value_vector.
00133         %>        
00134         %> @retval M return matrix
00135         % =================================================================         
00136         function M=get_matrix(dg_obj)           
00137            dg_obj.matrix(:)=dg_obj.value_list(:);           
00138            M=dg_obj.matrix;
00139         end
00140        
00141         % =================================================================
00142         %> @brief Update matrix property in object using current value_list
00143         %> vector from object.
00144         % =================================================================      
00145         function update_matrix(dg_obj)           
00146            dg_obj.matrix(:)=dg_obj.value_list(:);                                 
00147         end
00148         
00149         % =================================================================        
00150         %> @brief Update value_list vector property in object using current
00151         %> matrix property from object.
00152         % =================================================================
00153         function update_value_list(dg_obj)
00154            dg_obj.value_list(:)=dg_obj.matrix(:);                         
00155         end
00156         
00157         % =================================================================
00158         %> @brief Set display threshold. Function is overload. Two modes are 
00159         %> available: 'thresholds' or 'auto'.
00160         %>
00161         %> @param varargin{1} mode - 'auto' or 'threshold'
00162         %> @param varargin{2} value of lower threshold (if threshold mode enable else without this field)
00163         %> @param varargin{3} value of upper threshold (if threshold mode enable else without this field)       
00164         % =================================================================
00165        function set_display_thresholds(varargin)
00166            
00167            % auto
00168            if nargin==2
00169                 dg_obj=varargin{1};
00170                 mode=varargin{2};
00171                 if (strcmp(mode,'auto'))
00172                     dg_obj.threshold_mode='auto'; 
00173                 else
00174                     error 'Incorrect threshold mode'
00175                 end
00176                 
00177            % thresholds
00178            elseif nargin==4
00179                 dg_obj=varargin{1};
00180                 mode=varargin{2};
00181                 lt_tmp=varargin{3};
00182                 ut_tmp=varargin{4};
00183                 
00184                 if (strcmp(mode,'thresholds'))
00185                     dg_obj.threshold_mode='thresholds'; 
00186                     
00187                     if(lt_tmp>ut_tmp)
00188                          error 'lower threshold value is greater than higher';
00189                     elseif (lt_tmp==ut_tmp)
00190                         error 'lower threshold value is equal higher'
00191                     end                          
00192                     dg_obj.lt=lt_tmp;
00193                     dg_obj.ut=ut_tmp;
00194                     dg_obj.threshold_mode=mode;
00195                     
00196                 else
00197                     error 'Incorrect threshold mode'
00198                 end                                
00199                 
00200            else
00201                error 'Incorrect number of input elements'
00202            end
00203            
00204         end     
00205     
00206         % =====================================================================
00207         %> @brief Overload matlabs function use to display. Display current
00208         %> value_list (reshaped into matrix form)- graphical representation .
00209         % =====================================================================
00210         % function display(dg_obj)
00211         display(dg_obj);
00212         
00213         % =====================================================================
00214         %> @brief Overload matlabs function use to add objects to each other. Add discretization
00215         %> grid objects = add objects value_list vectors and create new grid object
00216         %> (object has the same dimension but with new value_list vector).
00217         %>
00218         %> Dimension of p and q must be the same.
00219         %> @param p discretization grid object
00220         %> @param q discretization grid object
00221         %> @retval r discretization grid object
00222         % =====================================================================
00223         % function r = plus( p,q )
00224         r = plus( p,q );
00225         
00226    end % methods
